trans-unit.source: Pelican plugin implementing Linkback protocols, on the linking server side.
trans-unit.target: Pelican plugin implementing Linkback protocols, on the linking server side.

trans-unit.source: LINKBACKS_CACHEPATH (optional, default: $CACHE_PATH/pelican-plugin-linkbacks.json, where $CACHE_PATH is a Pelican setting) : the path to the JSON file containg this plugin cache (a list of URLs already processed).
trans-unit.target: LINKBACKS_CACHEPATH (optional, default: $CACHE_PATH/pelican-plugin-linkbacks.json , where $CACHE_PATH is a Pelican setting) : the path to the JSON file containg this plugin cache (a list of URLs already processed).

trans-unit.source: LINKBACKS_CERT_VERIFY (optional, default: False) : enforce HTTPS certificates verification when sending linkbacks
trans-unit.target: LINKBACKS_CERT_VERIFY (optional, default: False ) : enforce HTTPS certificates verification when sending linkbacks

trans-unit.source: LINKBACKS_REQUEST_TIMEOUT (optional, in seconds, default: 3) : time in seconds allowed for each HTTP linkback request before abandon
trans-unit.target: LINKBACKS_REQUEST_TIMEOUT (optional, in seconds, default: 3 ) : time in seconds allowed for each HTTP linkback request before abandon

trans-unit.source: LINKBACKS_USERAGENT (optional, default: pelican-plugin-linkbacks) : the User-Agent HTTP header to use while sending notifications.
trans-unit.target: LINKBACKS_USERAGENT (optional, default: pelican-plugin-linkbacks ) : the User-Agent HTTP header to use while sending notifications.

trans-unit.source: A linkback is a method for Web authors to obtain notifications when other authors link to one of their documents. This enables authors to keep track of who is linking to, or referring to, their articles. The four methods (Refback, Trackback, Pingback and Webmention) differ in how they accomplish this task.
trans-unit.target: 当其他作者链接到他们的文档时,网络作者可以获得通知,链接回链是一种方法。这使作者能够跟踪谁在链接或引用他们的文章。四种方法(Refback、Trackback、Pingback和Webmention)在完成这项任务的方式上有所不同。

trans-unit.source: Contributing
trans-unit.target: 贡献

trans-unit.source: Contributions are welcome and much appreciated. Every little bit helps. You can contribute by improving the documentation, adding missing features, and fixing bugs. You can also help out by reviewing and commenting on existing issues.
trans-unit.target: Contributions are welcome and much appreciated. Every little bit helps. You can contribute by improving the documentation, adding missing features, and fixing bugs. You can also help out by reviewing and commenting on existing issues.

trans-unit.source: Do not hesitate to suggest other protocols, or report your experience with this plugin, by submitting an issue.
trans-unit.target: Do not hesitate to suggest other protocols, or report your experience with this plugin, by submitting an issue.

trans-unit.source: For Pingbacks, I used for my tests a Wordpress instance launched with Docker:
trans-unit.target: 对于Pingbacks,我使用了一个用Docker启动的Wordpress实例进行测试。

trans-unit.source: For WebMentions specifically, the webmention.io service can be useful.
trans-unit.target: For WebMentions specifically, the webmention.io service can be useful.

trans-unit.source: For every hyperlink in your articles, this plugin will notify their hosting websites (just those supporting a Linkback protocol) of those references.
trans-unit.target: 对于你文章中的每一个超链接,这个插件都会通知他们的托管网站(只是那些支持Linkback协议的网站)这些引用。

trans-unit.source: From my experience, you'll also have to:
trans-unit.target: 根据我的经验,你还得。

trans-unit.source: I invite you to read this Wikipedia page for more information & links: Linkback
trans-unit.target: I invite you to read this Wikipedia page for more information & links: Linkback

trans-unit.source: In order to avoid the repetitive CPU / bandwidth cost of repeatedly performing links parsing & linkback notifications, this hook only proceed to do so once, the first time an article is published.
trans-unit.target: In order to avoid the repetitive CPU / bandwidth cost of repeatedly performing links parsing & linkback notifications, this hook only proceed to do so once, the first time an article is published.

trans-unit.source: In order to do so, it uses a very simple and small cache that contains the list of all hyperlinks already parsed, per article slug.
trans-unit.target: In order to do so, it uses a very simple and small cache that contains the list of all hyperlinks already parsed, per article slug .

trans-unit.source: Install the package from Pypi: pip install pelican-plugin-linkbacks
trans-unit.target: Install the package from Pypi: pip install pelican-plugin-linkbacks

trans-unit.target: Pelican插件,在链接服务器端实现Linkback协议。

trans-unit.source: Protocols currently implemented:
trans-unit.target: 目前正在执行的议定书。

trans-unit.source: Releasing a new version
trans-unit.target: 发布新版本

This plugin does not perform inclusion of Linkbacks in your articles / as comments, for every website referencing your content following a Linkback protocol, because this cannot be performed by a static website generator like Pelican.

trans-unit.source: To enable this plugin:
trans-unit.target: 要启用这个插件。

trans-unit.source: To execute them:
trans-unit.target: 要执行它们。

trans-unit.source: To remove a blog entry from cache, in order for the plugin to retry sending a linkback:
trans-unit.target: 要从缓存中删除一个博客条目,以便让插件重新尝试发送回链。

trans-unit.source: To start contributing to this plugin, review the Contributing to Pelican documentation, beginning with the Contributing Code section.
trans-unit.target: To start contributing to this plugin, review the Contributing to Pelican documentation, beginning with the Contributing Code section.

trans-unit.source: What are linkbacks?
trans-unit.target: 什么是linkbacks?

trans-unit.source: What does this plugin do?
trans-unit.target: 这个插件是做什么的?

trans-unit.source: When you enable this plugin the first time, it will process all the hyperlinks of your existing articles. It will do it only once, and then create a cache file to avoid processing those links next time. Still, because the publish step will be longer than usual the first time you enable this plugin, I recommend to use pelican -D flag to get debug logs, and hence follow the plugin progress.
trans-unit.target: When you enable this plugin the first time, it will process all the hyperlinks of your existing articles. It will do it only once, and then create a cache file to avoid processing those links next time. Still, because the publish step will be longer than usual the first time you enable this plugin, I recommend to use pelican -D flag to get debug logs, and hence follow the plugin progress.

trans-unit.source: configure a local MySQL database to accept connections from $WORDPRESS_DB_USER:$WORDPRESS_DB_PASSWORD
trans-unit.target: configure a local MySQL database to accept connections from $WORDPRESS_DB_USER:$WORDPRESS_DB_PASSWORD

trans-unit.source: configure the http_request_host_is_external Wordpress filter to always return true, so that it won't reject host.docker.internal links
trans-unit.target: configure the http_request_host_is_external Wordpress filter to always return true , so that it won't reject host.docker.internal links

trans-unit.source: configure the xmlrpc_pingback_error Wordpress filter to be passthrough, to get useful error messages
trans-unit.target: configure the xmlrpc_pingback_error Wordpress filter to be passthrough, to get useful error messages

trans-unit.target: perform a release on GitGub, including the description added to CHANGELOG.md

trans-unit.target: update CHANGELOG.md

trans-unit.target: wp-includes/class-wp-xmlrpc-server.php

trans-unit.target: wp-includes/comment.php

trans-unit.source: ❌ Refback: won't be implemented because it requires to retrieve the HTTP Referer header, which cannot be done by Pelican, a static blog engine
trans-unit.target: ❌ Refback: won't be implemented because it requires to retrieve the HTTP Referer header, which cannot be done by Pelican, a static blog engine

trans-unit.source: ❌ TalkBack: won't be implemented because it did not gain enough popularity / traction since its birth in 2011
trans-unit.target: ❌ TalkBack: won't be implemented because it did not gain enough popularity / traction since its birth in 2011

trans-unit.source: ❌ Trackback (protocol spec): won't be implemented because it does not seem widely used, and requires to parse embedded RDF documents (enclosed in HTML comments as a fallback), which seems a poor design in an era of HTML5 / RDFa
trans-unit.target: ❌ Trackback (protocol spec): won't be implemented because it does not seem widely used, and requires to parse embedded RDF documents (enclosed in HTML comments as a fallback), which seems a poor design in an era of HTML5 / RDFa
